The answer was made him that if he would return home he should be made one of the two k‘ings who are appointed yearly at Carthage. His property was confiscated by the Carthaginians, and he himself declared an exile.

VIII. If he can, Hannibal will persuade Antio- chus to advance into Italy with his armies. But when the Carthaginians learn that he has made this attempt (say “ attempted this ''), they will inflict the same penalty on Mago as on Hannibal.
